Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "macOS support for 2.1.0-preview1-final?" (#3035) at aspnet/Home
Events.RelatedBody: Using the latest beta release of Visual Studio for Mac, [which should have support for 2.1](https://blogs.msdn.microsoft.com/visualstudio/2018/03/21/visual-studio-for-mac-version-7-5-preview-1/). I installed 2.1 preview using the link on the [announcement blog post](https://blogs.msdn.microsoft.com/webdev/2018/02/27/asp-net-core-2-1-0-preview1-now-available/). > $ dotnet --version > 2.1.300-preview1-008174 Followed the steps from the announcement blog post linked above and restarted my computer. I'm seeing this in the project options: For step 9 in the announcement blog post, is this checkbox in another location in Visual Studio for Mac? > 9: Open the “Debug” tab and in the IIS Express profile, check the “Enable SSL” checkbox and save the changes I attempted to run the project from CLI and it says it's running, but going to localhost:5000 shows it's not really running. Please let me know if I am missing something or if this should be posted somewhere else.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Xamarin Forms app is using AspNetCore.Signal.Client but it doesnot connect with AspNetCore.Signal Server " (#3083) at aspnet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
I am trying to develop a project with Angular5, AspNetCore 2 and Xamarin and I need to use AspNetCore.Signalr to make a chat app ( the app isnot chat app, chat will be a modul ) so First , I downloaded **Microsoft.AspNetCore.SignalR -Version 1.0.0-preview1-final** for Signalr Server Second I downloaded **Microsoft.AspNetCore.SignalR.Client -Version 1.0.0-preview1-final** for Xamarin.Forms application to build a client app. I could connected to Signalr Server with Angular app but I couldnot connect with Xamarin Client app . I am using ngrok to access my localhost in Xamarin app and I always got **101 switching protocol**  error  however, when I use same ngrok link in Angular app there is no problem I could access to Signalr  server. Also I watched Visual Studio Output section it seems try to connect to Server because I am seeing same connectionid in Server and Client app at VS output section  anyway I am using this code to connect to server from Xamarin app
               
                              _hub = new HubConnectionBuilder()
                                          .WithUrl("http://.../getchat")                 
                                          .WithConsoleLogger(LogLevel.Debug)
                                          .Build();

                                await _hub.StartAsync();

I havenot listened any method in SignalR server because when app connect to server, I want to see accessing **OnConnectedAsync** method at my hub class

What should I do?

I am using ngrok to access my localhost in Xamarin app and I always got **101 switching protocol**  error  however, when I use same ngrok link in Angular app there is no problem I could access to Signalr  server. Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Websocket fails" (#3082) at aspnet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
I've followed the instructions in the [documentation](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/aspnet/core/fundamentals/websockets?view=aspnetcore-2.1) and created a simple echo websocket application to begin with.

Since I have no client yet, I used the one from [websocket.org](http://websocket.org/echo.html). On connecting, this exception is thrown:

**The remote party closed the WebSocket connection without completing the close handshake.**

I'm not closing anything. I'm just connecting and then want to send something through the connection to have it echoed by my application. but it doesn't get that far and already believes the client has misbehaved and closed the connection. Which I cannot believe because the demo works nicely with the websocket.org echo server.

```
   at System.Net.WebSockets.ManagedWebSocket.<ReceiveAsyncPrivate>d__61.MoveNext()
--- End of stack trace from previous location where exception was thrown ---
   at System.Runtime.ExceptionServices.ExceptionDispatchInfo.Throw()
   at System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TaskAwaiter.HandleNonSuccessAndDebuggerNotification(Task task)
   at System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TaskAwaiter`1.GetResult()
   at DemoServer.Controllers.RmpController.<Echo>d__1.MoveNext() in C:\Source\Komprenu\RoutedMessagingProtocol\DemoServer\Controllers\RmpController.cs:line 37
--- End of stack trace from previous location where exception was thrown ---
   at System.Runtime.ExceptionServices.ExceptionDispatchInfo.Throw()
   at System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TaskAwaiter.HandleNonSuccessAndDebuggerNotification(Task task)
   at DemoServer.Controllers.RmpController.<Index>d__0.MoveNext() in C:\Source\Komprenu\RoutedMessagingProtocol\DemoServer\Controllers\RmpController.cs:line 22
```

I'm using the latest versions of VS 2017 and .NET Core. Testing with Firefox. There was an older issue somewhere here that was resolved. I'm not sure where this error comes from but it means that I cannot use Websockets right now, which is very unfortunate (I'd say critical).

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Minor API related things found while documenting" (#2131) at aspnet/SignalR
Events.RelatedBody:
Some minor API things I have noticed while documenting. I don't know if these meet the change bar.

IHubClientsExtensions -> should be named HubClientsExtensions. (since it itself is not an interface)

DynamicHubClients.Users(IReadOnlyList<string> users) -> should be userIds for consistency

Events.RelatedBody: We should log the version of the client (.NET/JS/whatever) and the version of the server to help diagnose issues when devs create issues with attached logs.

Events.RelatedBody:
Hi

Trying to install asp net core signalr client on to my xamarin.forms app. I make a brand new xamarin.forms project, then install the signalr client, lastest preview version and an error pop ups. Does this actually works or is using signalr in a xamarin app impossible yet? I need to know since it's part of my dissertation project.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "InvalidOperationException on new project based on VS docker template." (#7699) at aspnet/Mvc
Events.RelatedBody:
### Title
InvalidOperationException on new project based on VS docker template.

### Functional impact
It prevents a newly created project from running.

### Minimal repro steps
Setup a project based on the following Visual Studio Project Settings:

- .NET Core
- ASP.NET Core 2.0
- Web Application (Model-View-Controller)
- Authentcation: Individual User Accounts - Store user accounts in-app
- Enable Docker Support (OS: Windows)

Start debugging with the docker configuration.

### Expected result
If you start debugging with docker, the app should start up. A project created with a VS template should work without further configuration.

### Actual result
The following exception gets thrown during `BuildWebHost(args).Run();`

`System.InvalidOperationException: 'HTTPS endpoints can only be configured using KestrelServerOptions.Listen().'`

### Additional Info
A project with the same configuration but without docker support works out of the box.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Naming mismatch IUrlHelper extensions vs Request" (#7697) at aspnet/Mvc
Events.RelatedBody:
We have this extension 

    string RouteUrl(this IUrlHelper helper, string routeName, object values, string protocol, string host, string fragment)

If we do the following in a razor view, this is not correct:

    @Url.RouteUrl("routename", new {parameter=1}, Context.Request.Protocol, Context.Request.Host.Value, "myhash")

It actually expects

    @Url.RouteUrl("routename", new {parameter=1}, Context.Request.Scheme, Context.Request.Host.Value, "myhash")

A bit confusing? Easy to fix, but not as intuitive as it could be.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "FileSystemWatcher is not released properly (OutOfMemoryException)" (#7696) at aspnet/Mvc
Opened issue "Update Mvc 1.1.x to reference Microsoft.Extensions.DependencyModel with fix" (#7695) at aspnet/Mvc
Events.RelatedBody: Running a 1.1 Mvc app with project references breaks when using the 2.0 SDK - https://github.com/dotnet/sdk/issues/1488. The fix involves a change to Microsoft.Extensions.DependencyModel. https://github.com/dotnet/core-setup/issues/3081 tracks creating a 1.1 patch version of Microsoft.Extensions.DependencyModel. We should consider patching Mvc to reference this version when the package becomes available.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "stay logged in for longer than 30 minutes - expire what?" (#1766) at aspnet/Identity
Events.RelatedBody:
Hello.  So there's a ton of information regarding cookies and expiration, and the ticket vs the cookie containing the ticket.  I get that.

I just need my users to be able to stay logged in, for let's say for 8 hours, if they choose "remember" me, which then gets passed to signinmanager.signinasync().  My "cookie" shows 2 weeks of life in the browser .. which I believe this is from the options.expiretimespan property.  I'm ok with this.

I just do not understand from other articles and logged issues how to allow that 14 day cookie to actually contain "something" (need the term please) that allows them to close the browser, re-open it in 4 hours, and have to log back in because of a 401.  What is the term i am looking for, and where can I set it to make their "credentials via the cookie" value say for 4 hours.  4 hours is probably a good example.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "UserManager.FindByNameAsync doesn't get roles [QUESTION]" (#1763) at aspnet/Identity
Events.RelatedBody:
I recently just migrated my .NET Core 1.1.4 app over to .NET Core 2. Everything builds and compiles, but my identity stuff are all messed up. When I do a call to `UserManage.FindByNameAsync(email)`, The correct user is found. However, his role count is 0.

I read somewhere that Net Core 2 no longer eager/lazy loads. I'm still new to .NET Core environment and have been put in the deep end. How would I work around this to get the UserManager to work again? It used to work fine in .NET Core 1.1

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Lower level middleware" (#2512) at aspnet/KestrelHttpServer
Events.RelatedBody:
A lot of applications have to deal with the same pipeline as an http server up until protocol handling. 
An MQTT broker for example could reuse kestrel code from the tcp connection middleware forward. 
Is there any change of decoupling kestrel this way?

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "InvalidOperationException: Invalid non-ASCII or control character in header: 0x00F8" (#2508) at aspnet/KestrelHttpServer
Events.RelatedBody:
When getting files from Azure Blob Storage in my ASP.NET Core application, I obtain a temporary URI with an access signature and then redirect the user to that URI, like this:

```
type FileController () =
    inherit Controller(container: FileContainer)
 
    member this.GetFile(path: string) =
          let blob = container.GetBlockBlobReference path
          ...
          let sasContainerToken = blob.GetSharedAccessSignature(policy)
          let uri = Uri(blob.Uri, sasContainerToken)
          this.Response.Redirect(string uri)
```

This works fine until I try to get a file with a nordic character (ø). Then it crashes:

```

Accessing the generated URI manually (without redirecting) properly returns the file.

How can I work around this?

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Simplify build + retarget tests to netcoreapp2.1 " (#2293) at aspnet/Razor
Opened pull request "Disable node-reuse to allow rebuilding" (#2292) at aspnet/Razor
Events.RelatedBody:
Recent builds of msbuild have node reuse enabled by default. This locks up the task dlls after the test's completed preventing re-runs untill you kill the process.

Here's the process at work after running dotnet test.
```
"\.dotnet\x64\dotnet.exe" "\.dotnet\x64\sdk\2.1.300-preview2-008530\MSBuild.dll" \.dotnet\x64\sdk\2.1.300-preview2-008530\MSBuild.dll /nologo /nodemode:1 /nodeReuse:true
```

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue ".Net Core 2.0 mvc.razor.viewcompilation.rsp build exception MSB3073 exited with code -2147450751" (#2280) at aspnet/Razor
Events.RelatedBody:
_From @DenisKot on April 15, 2018 17:46_

Build solution fails with strange error:

> Error	MSB3073	The command ""dotnet" exec --runtimeconfig "F:\TrackTubeNew\Src\TreckTube\bin\Debug\netcoreapp2.0\TreckTube.Web.runtimeconfig.json" --depsfile "F:\TrackTubeNew\Src\TreckTube\bin\Debug\netcoreapp2.0\TreckTube.Web.deps.json" "C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk\NuGetFallbackFolder\microsoft.aspnetcore.mvc.razor.viewcompilation\2.0.0\build\netstandard2.0\Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.Razor.ViewCompilation.dll" @"obj\Debug\netcoreapp2.0\microsoft.aspnetcore.mvc.razor.viewcompilation.rsp"" exited with code -2147450751.	TreckTube.Web	C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk\NuGetFallbackFolder\microsoft.aspnetcore.mvc.razor.viewcompilation\2.0.0\build\netstandard2.0\Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.Razor.ViewCompilation.targets	60	

If double click on error VS opens up file:

> C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk\NuGetFallbackFolder\microsoft.aspnetcore.mvc.razor.viewcompilation\2.0.0\build\netstandard2.0\Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.Razor.ViewCompilation.targets

At line:
`<Exec Command="$(ExecArgs)" WorkingDirectory="$(MSBuildProjectDirectory)" />`

To fix it I've tried to update .net core libraries from version 2.0.0. to 2.0.6, have been update visual studio 2017 to 17.6.6, even revret my changes but nothing is helping.

How to fix it?

_Copied from original issue: dotnet/corefx#29125_

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Make tooling support splitting asp.net and bootstrapping in different projects (onion architecture)" (#823) at aspnet/Tooling
Events.RelatedBody:
I'd like to see better tooling support for a more onion architecture like solution structure.

For instance
- Solution
  - Core (business logic, domain model, etc)
  - Infrastructure.EntityFramework (DAL)
  - Presentation.ASPNET (MVC or WebApi)
  - Bootstrapper (Program.cs and Startup.cs)

So basically I just moved Program.cs and Startup.cs to another project. This is important because according to the onion architecture Presentation.ASPNET should not have references to Entity Framework.

If I do this today I loose the "IIS Express" run button and I cannot publish via wed deploy in the way I'm used to. Plus a ton of other issues.

Would be sweet if there was better support for this setup :)

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Support debugging of JS executed with EdgeJS in VS" (#240) at aspnet/Tooling
Events.RelatedBody:
We would like to do the server side HTML rendering with ReactJS in our ASP.NET application. This works with EdgeJS, but there is currently no way to debug the JS code in VS. 

It would be nice if this would work and we wouldn't need node-inspector for this.

https://github.com/tjanczuk/edge/issues/316

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Switch between Razor Page View and Code Behind" (#1068) at aspnet/Tooling
Events.RelatedBody: In the old web forms you were able to quickly switch between the ASPX file and the code behind using F7/Shift F7 or going View->Code or View->Designer. It would be useful if this was possible with Razor Pages in aspnet core projects?
